title: Is it me or is it lately pretty easy to get frustrated with league?
body:
So many stupid mechanics and gimmick's are being added and matchmaking is also pretty bad....

Also the FOTM champions are pretty annoying to face (like hecarim or anivia). If a champion like ziggs was fotm it would be annoying but not as annoying as the current FOTM champs.

replies.body:
Its just you.

Its always been easy to get frustrated with league.

Can confirm, been playing since the end of season 1.

There's always bullshit. Always imbalance. I've been through assassin metas, tank metas. Adc metas (well, extra meta I guess, since adc has always been required since I've played). 

None of it feels good when you're dealing with it, you just either learn to suck it up or stop playing.

my friends and i have pretty much stopped playing, but i vigilantly watch for the winds of change.
if riot does something like a 20% damage reduction we'll come back
cya

K so as strong as hec is/was there is plenty of ways to counter him. He will always have to charge through your frontline, and he will usually try to do this without his ult. So stop him. EZ. If he does ult, now hes stuck behind enemy lines, and provided that your front line doesn't let anyone else throught, Hec will be soloing 2 or 3 damage dealers. Unless you have fed him to the point of obesity, he is not THAT strong. Also, if you have ever played hecarim, you will know that champs with persistent slows and/or terrain creation absolutely destroy him. Azir's ult is easily the number 1 hec counter.

However, I will agree with you that matchmaking is in the toilet, and this is due to DQ literally destroying the ladder and allowing boosted trash to play with/against players so far out of their league that they simply cannot function.
Nope you are wrong, I was playing azir, A hecarim ulted onto me, I ulted as he was about to hit me, The wall didn't knock him back at all but it did damage, Could have been a bug though.

...

You can't displace Hecarim durning his ult.

Ya you played it wrong...either u ult him when he is charging (his e speed boost), which will force him to ult over the wall and likely to his death, or you wait for him to burn the ult, then push him away with yours. Either way, he's gonna be in a sticky situation.
ohkay. :3
Seriously I HATE playing against azir for this reason. Just don't get too trigger happy on the ult. Always better if you hold it and use it to disengage then wasting it only to have him ult over it.

I just started again after not playing for ~2 months. I've done nothing but dick around as support sona and "support" veigar.

I'm pretty pissed because Riot nerfs champs that are in the "spotlight" and were played a lot than never compensates. Ehem look at Kalista right now and even Poppy... I remember reading a post awhile back where a Rioter said "Yeah we have like a spotlight and champions shouldn't be in it for so long" but they shouldn't even have a spotlight in the first place ==

And the difference between the spotlight now and couple seasons ago is that a couple seasons ago you could handle the FOTM champs. The shit we have no is tanky, with CC and damage and there is no coming back from that once you're behind. Gl dealing with a fed poppy where a fed shyvana could be dealt with.

It's you. You're not living in balance with it. We must go outside of our houses, take a long walk in nature, perhaps go for a cup of coffee by ourselves in a coffee shop and just take in our surroundings. These things reestablish our psyche's balance, so we will be largely immune to tilting and overall frustration. Too much playing LoL in the dark and experiencing the same thing over again doesn't mean the experience is less fun, it means that our psyche is agitated because we aren't doing anything else productive with our time. anything will become frustrating and agitating, even the most enjoyable things in life, if we stay inside and pursue them constantly.
